MICA is an exceptionally lamellar aluminium and potassium phyllosilicate. Mica particles can also be conveniently broken into thin pieces, mostly translucent. Throughout the spectrum of naturally accessible particle sizes from a micron to a few centimetres, micas are rare amongst flat minerals. Mica is also named “glimmer,” which defines the optical appearance it provides.

MICA FLAKES were typically used as an additive mound chemical to avoid lack of circulation and absorption during water-based and oil-based oil-well drilling operations. In order to repair the missing diffusion areas, Mica is explicitly applied. By utilizing mica, porous types are screened, and diffusion retention helps hold the solids under suspension.

Wet Ground Mica Powder
A wide range of Wet Ground Mica Powder is manufactured, supplied and exported. Our Mica Powder Wet Ground is commonly used in industries such as rubber, plastics, painting, cosmetics, etc. It is a blocking and ant containing agent, the most important feature of our range. Our customers highly enjoy our wet ground mica rock. The quality and durability of our product are well known.

Dry Ground Mica Powder
We manufacture the best raw material from our own factories for Dry Ground Mica Powder. Our Dry Ground Mica Powder is produced in hammer mills and screened to the necessary mesh size. For its manufacturing, good quality raw material is used. We sell 60 mesh and 100 mesh regular sizes. Our mica is used in paints, fabrics, welding electrodes, chemicals for wall boards, etc.

Coloured Mica
Created from the finest quality mica flakes. The coloration is carried out with high heat resistant pigments that also avoid any future colour fading during usage. It is often used to produce characteristics, such as granite and marble in plastics, paints, glass and ceramics.

Physical Properties
  • Chemical resistance
  • Thermal conductivity (anisotropic)
  • Heat stability, passive fire retardancy
  • Vibration damping
  • Low coefficient of friction (lubricants, extrusion)
  • Hydrophilic
  • Flexible

excerpt.rendered: ProductsMICAMICA is an exceptionally lamellar aluminium and potassium phyllosilicate. Mica particles can also be conveniently broken into thin pieces, mostly translucent. Throughout the spectrum of naturally accessible particle sizes from a micron to a few centimetres, micas are rare amongst flat minerals. Mica is also named “glimmer,” which defines the optical appearance it provides. MICA […]
